temperatures in rural areas are likely to drop .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f )
saturday should get off to a dry start with some sunshine , but eventually cloud will thicken and there 'll be the risk of showers - some again turning heavy and thundery .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f )

documents.title: norwich lap dancing clubs 'are not bad neighbours '
text: a lawyer for one of the norwich lap dancing clubs applying for a new licence has insisted that the industry is responsible and `` a good neighbour '' .

sarah le feuvre , counsel for lace on prince of wales road told the city council 's licencing committee `` in general , premises of this type do not give to issues of crime , disorder or public nuisance '' .
`` in 10 years of trading we have had an excellent workig relationship with the authorities , '' she said .
the club , which employs between 8 and 16 dancers and has an average of 55 customers a night , is one of four in the city applying for a new sexual entertainment venue licence .

at the start of the meeting , which the chairperson described as `` rather unusual '' , councillors were told that lap dancing clubs are lawful and they must not judge the applications on moral grounds .
but there was an appeal from the green party for a cap to be placed on the number of clubs in the city .
councillor lesley grahame said `` this will send a message that norwich is a soft touch and make it a destination for more stag parties '' .
a decision will be made later this afternoon .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: honeymoon couple now safe at resort hit by hurricane irma
text: a norfolk couple , on honeymoon in the dominican republic , is said to be safe and well after being caught up in hurricane irma .
mariah and michael brick , from great plumstead just east of norwich , spent the night sheltering in a stranger 's bathroom after the hotel they were staying in was evacuated .
they had arrived in the resort of punta cana just two days before the most powerful atlantic storm in history made land .
`` they called us on thursday night to say they were safe and sound and had returned to their hotel , '' said mariah 's mother , andrea crooks .
`` they said they were in their room waiting to hear about food as they have not eaten in a while . ''
the hotel was evacuated because it was `` unsafe '' .
`` it had a straw roof and was a very small hotel , so they have moved inland , '' ms crooks said .
`` they went to another hotel which was fully booked , but they talked to a belgian couple who let them stay in their bathroom until they could find somewhere else . ''
author: Graham Barnard
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: city lap dancing clubs ' licence renewals opposed by greens
text: the local authority is deciding today whether to renew the licences of four lap dancing clubs in the norwich .
lace , platinum lace , the b52 club and sugar & s are all applying for new sexual entertainment venue licences .
the green party is opposing the renewals and claims residents have n't been properly consulted .
the greens also said they worry the clubs will make the city `` a soft touch '' for stag parties .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: in the news : 3,700 pupils could lose free buses

author: Diss Express

documents.title: rent increase threatens two-day market , traders claim
text: traders on great yarmouth 's two-day market may not survive because of the number of stalls that are closing , it is claimed .
more than 20 stallholders have decided to leave the market since the beginning of the year , following an increase in rents - roughly a third of the existing stalls .
great yarmouth borough council says it 's given traders a 2.5 % cut in their rates to encourage more people to stay .
however , many of them took on more space over past years with no increase in overall fees in a bid to make the market look bigger .
under a new system of assessment for this year , fees will be charged on the whole size of stalls which means many traders are paying much more than they used to .
author: Jo Thewlis
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: too early to judge norwich city - grant holt
text: norwich city resume their championship campaign against birmingham city at carrow road on saturday .
the canaries have taken just four points from the first five games of the new season and have the worst defensive record in the division .

former city captain grant holt joined us on last night 's edition of the scrimmage on bbc radio norfolk and urged fans to give head coach daniel farke more time to find the right balance with his team .
`` they 're trying to build something , it 's going to take time to blend .
you can see why fans get frustrated because results are n't going their way , '' holt said .
we 'll be hearing from daniel farke later today .
there will be updates from his pre-match press conference at around 13:00 .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: wheelchair tennis : alfie hewett reaches another grand slam final
text: wheelchair tennis star alfie hewett will play in the final of the doubles at the us open .
the 19-year-old from cantley partnered gordon reid to a straight sets win over gustavo fernandez and shingo kunieda in the semi-final .
hewett will face kunieda again later , this time in the quarter finals of the wheelchair singles .
wheelchair on ashe : @ twitterid advance to the match , d. fernandez/kunieda 6-3 , 6-2 # usopen
great to see !
and a brilliant performance from both @ twitterid & @ twitterid
those wheelchair tennis players are quite amazing !
so grateful to have seen this terrific match in person !
thanks @ twitterid for putting it on ashe !

yipppeee ! !
# otbc ! ! !
great match !
great work !
a bunch of forehand net winners on 2 the final !
its great that you have put these amazing and accomplished players on the big court .

documents.title: fatal crash teenager had a 'cheeky smile '
text: the parents of a teenager who was killed in a fatal collision say their son was `` one of the most polite , caring , funny young men you could ever wish to meet '' .
matthew woodward , 18 , died when his red mini coooper was in collision with a blue vauxhall zafira on the a134 at mundford .
it happened close to the junction with the a11 at around 05:00 on saturday , 2 september .
paying tribute to `` their beautiful boy '' , matthew 's parents said `` with his cheeky smile and his quick witty sense of humour there was never a dull moment in his company '' .
he worked hard at night to earn his money to make his little mini stand out from the crowd .
his pride and joy , which sadly never brought him home . ''

documents.title: newcomer makes its home on nature reserve
text: a damselfly , which is a relative newcomer to the uk , has returned to a wetland habitat for a second summer .
the willow emerald damselfly was first recorded at the wildfowl and wetlands trust ( wwt ) at welney in 2016 .
this year the adult insects were again seen on the reserve .
welney volunteer annabelle hammond says the reserve now has 10 species of damselfly , which makes it home to half of uk damselfly species .
the willow emerald has become more widespread in the uk in the last 10 years - before that there had only been two uk records for the insect .
unlike other damselfly species , this metallic green insect perches on trees rather than grasses and wild flowers .
it lays its eggs in willow trees that overhang water , rather than using soft plants on or beneath the water surface .
they hold their wings out from their bodies in 45-degree angles at rest , and fly later in the season than other damselflies .

documents.title: city youngster hopes to catch farke 's eye after joining from liverpool

documents.title: university calls for parity between art and science
text: a norfolk university is calling for parity between arts and science subjects .
john last , vice chancellor of the norwich university of the arts , wants the government to rethink their decision to omit the arts from the `` core '' subjects of the baccalaureate in schools .
he says that ignoring the economic value of the arts is to ignore the £ 84bn annual contribution to the british economy from the creative industries .
mr last says it 's important that everybody is given a three-dimensional education .
the rounded education is what we 're in danger of losing if we do n't review what the bacc is doing in our schools i think everybody benefits from the opportunity to be creative . ''

documents.title: the latest forecast : becoming cloudy with rain
text: make the most of any bright spells , the skies will be clouding over later , with outbreaks of rain expected .
temperatures peaking at 19c ( 66f ) .
here 's some scenes from around the county , taken earlier this morning by our band of weather watchers .

documents.title: restaurant plans to stake its claim further north
text: the boss of a restaurant chain in norfolk says they 're planning to expand in to the north of england .
the middletons steakhouse chain was founded in the village of middleton near king 's lynn in 2011 .
initially it employed 50 people , with an annual turnover of £ 1m .
six years later , and their turnover is approximately £ 14m , with 350 employees .
yesterday the restaurant opened the doors of its seventh site - in peterborough .
it 's their largest , with 240 covers .
managing director stephen hutton says they want to get even bigger .
we 're always looking for new sites next year we 're hoping to open at least two , maybe three , venturing further north to places like leeds , sheffield , derby . ''

documents.title: cromer disturbance : 'it 's time to support our police '
text: the man in charge of security at cromer carnival says it 's time to get behind our police .
last night , the chief constable , simon bailey , apologised to the community at a public meeting following disturbances in the town three weeks ago .
more than 20 crimes are being investigated , including the rape of a woman .
pat west says the town must now put the events of last month behind them .
there 's only so many times a man can apologise .
we 've got to get behind the police now and support them , in particular the chief constable because he 's got norfolk at his heart and he deserves our support really . ''

documents.title: fire crews return to recycling plant blaze
text: firefighters are back at the scene of a blaze which broke out at a recycling plant near thetford yesterday .
crews were called to viridor recycling at wretham earlier this morning after a small area re-ignited .
they are expected to remain on site to monitor the situation .
at the height of the blaze yesterday , up to 100 firefighters from norfolk and suffolk were there (
people living nearby were advised to keep their doors and windows closed .

documents.title: 'communication failure ' led to cromer disturbances
text: norfolk 's chief constable has told a public meeting in cromer that a failure in communication was partly to blame for disturbances in the town last month , which local people are blaming on a group of travellers .
norfolk police has previously confirmed suffolk police had made them aware of a group leaving lowestoft and heading north .
simon bailey confirmed the relevant information was not passed on to the duty officer in norfolk 's control room .
businesses say they were forced to close after a wave of crime , including a rape , hit the town .
mr bailey said they were investigating the links between the trouble and one extended family of travellers .

we 're looking to secure any forensic evidence we can seizing all cctv material once we 've got all that material we will look at identifying and putting names to faces , and circulating those individuals as being wanted on the police national computer with a view to them being arrested as soon as we can . ''

documents.title: wright makes top 10 at world championships
text: norfolk 's sophie wright made up three places on the final lap to secure eighth spot in the junior cross country event at the mountain biking world championships in australia .
sophie , 18 and from horsford , won a national mountain bike event earlier this year just 12 days after heart surgery .
all action as @ twitterid and @ twitterid raced in the junior women 's xco event .

documents.title: man banned from keeping animals after abandoning cats
text: a man who abandoned his two cats when he moved house and claimed they had run away has been banned from keeping animals for five years .
winston amos , 43 , locked fluffy and smudge outside his home in great ryburgh , norfolk - then moved 40 miles away to wisbech , king 's lynn magistrates heard .
prosecutor jonathan eales told the court a neighbour raised the alarm with the rspca after seeing mr amos and his wife leave the cats behind .
the couple were both charged with two counts of failing to meet the welfare needs of a cat or to protect a cat from suffering as a consequence of being left unattended at a property .
mr amos , of osborne road , wisbech , admitted the offences in a letter sent to the court .
the case against mrs amos was adjourned until november while efforts are made to contact her .
the court heard that one of the cats was pregnant and both were suffering from ear mites and a flea infestation .
chairman of the bench william hush banned mr amos from keeping animals for five years , fined him £ 440 and ordered £ 120 costs .
it is understood both cats have been rehomed .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norfolk scientist rejects beached whale theory
text: a norfolk-based scientist has rejected a theory that washed-up sperm whales were confused by changes to the earth 's magnetic field .
the theory says that the changes caused by solar flares confused nearly 30 whales into beaching around the north sea last year .
two came ashore at hunstanton .
dr ben garrod , from anglia ruskin university , ran tests on one of the whales and rejects the theory .
he said : `` we know that solar storms and solar energy has an impact on smaller animals , like birds and insects , but sperm whales have the biggest brain on the planet .
`` if this was purely down to solar storms - why did n't every whale in the ocean wash up ? ''
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .

documents.title: fire crews tackle blaze at recycling centre
text: more than 90 firefighters have been tackling a blaze at a recycling centre near thetford .
crews were called at about 02:45 .
residents in and around wretham have been asked to keep their doors and windows closed .
fire crews from across south norfolk and suffolk are currently fighting the blaze .
they say they have most of the blaze now under control .
group manager richard smith is in charge of the operation .
he said : `` at the moment we believe we 've got the vast majority of the fire under control .
`` it 's moving into a damping down operation to make sure we 've got all the hot spots . ''
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: parents 'dissatisfied ' with speech therapy service in norfolk
text: most parents in norfolk are `` very dissatisfied '' with the speech therapy in the county , a survey has found .
family voice norfolk , a group of parent carers from about 700 families , asked its members for their views on the services and had 70 responses .
it found that 64 % were very dissatisfied on the provision of therapy in terms of meeting the needs of their child .
the survey found that 18 % were quite dissatisfied , 8 % were were quite satisfied and 3 % were very satisfied with the service .

a norfolk county council spokeswoman said : `` we 've been working with the provider to address issues raised by parents around the speech and language therapy service , particularly relating to the delays that people have been experiencing .

`` we 're pleased that we 're already seeing encouraging improvements even in the wider context of a national shortage of speech and language therapists and an increase in demand on services which has been having an impact on the services provided in norfolk . ''
the council is discussing the issues at a meeting of the health scrutiny committee on thursday .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: 17th century shop saved by council
text: 17th century shop saved by council

documents.title: search launched for man in difficulty off lowestoft
text: an extensive search is being carried out off the coast at lowestoft , after reports were received by uk coastguard just before 13:00 of a man in trouble in the sea .
three rnli lifeboats , one from lowestoft and two from gorleston , are currently searching for the man , along with coastguard rescue teams from lowestoft , southwold and gorleston .
lifeguards from lowestoft are also involved , along with suffolk police and the coastguard search and rescue helicopter from lydd in kent .

documents.title: 'poldark ' ship sails into port
text: a three-masted tall ship , which starred in bbc one 's poldark , has arrived at great yarmouth for the town 's annual maritime festival .

`` kaskelot '' was built in 1948 at the svendborg shipyard in denmark , and has been used in a number of film and tv productions , including return to treasure island , the three musketeers and david copperfield .
she underwent a multi-million pound refit in 2013 , with more than 55,000 man hours invested to date .
around 30,000 visitors are expected to visit the festival this saturday and sunday .

other vessels on display will include the 1937 motor torpedo boat mtb102 and the brand new steam ship george stephenson , which was built using recycled or salvaged parts from ships , boats and buildings .

documents.title: police forces move into '21st century '
text: frontline police officers across norfolk and suffolk are being issued with tablets and mobile phones , to `` revolutionise '' the way in which they deal with incidents and the service they provide .

the move follows a three-month trial last year , which police say made it clear the devices offered officers what they needed - quick access to accurate information without the need to travel back to the station .

ch supt mike fawcett , project lead for norfolk and suffolk constabularies , said : `` this is very much an 'invest-to-save ' project - and i expect that the resource commitment we have made will bring us cost benefits in the long-term . ''
cambridgeshire police say their officers were given smartphones in 2006 , followed by laptops/slates from 2013 .
essex police officers have smart phones , not tablets .
they were introduced to the force in october 2016 and 2,000 are currently on issue .

documents.title: successful year crime-wise for sundown festival
text: police officers covering the sundown festival in norwich at the weekend say they were `` pleased '' with the behaviour of the majority of partygoers .
five people were arrested for drug offences , out of a total attendance of about 40,000 .
ch insp nathan clark said : `` given the thousands of people who attended the festival only a small minority chose to ignore our guidance and were arrested as a result . ''
he said a number of tents were also burgled , and `` small '' items taken .

documents.title: ex-footballer faces gross indecency trial
text: ex-footballer faces gross indecency trial

documents.title: wells fish and chip shop wins a 'plaice ' in shortlist for national award
text: a fish and chip shop in wells-next-the-sea has been named as one of the best two in eastern england , in a competition to find the best in the country .

platten 's fish and chips , in quayside , along with 19 others from across the country , will now compete for a place in the final and chance to claim the honour of being crowned number one in the 2018 national fish & chip awards .

competing shops have had their frying skills put to the test , as well as being assessed against a variety of judging criteria including menu development and innovation , sustainable sourcing policies , staff training processes and marketing activity .
the winner will be announced at a ceremony in london on 25 january 2018 .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: support for disabled and elderly people gets a revamp
text: norfolk county council is planning to change the way it cares for older and disabled people .
it says it wants to help people stay independent for longer , release staff from paperwork - and all without spending more money .
james bullion , executive director of adult social services , says : `` the driver for this is not about trying to reduce [ care ] packages or save money .
this is about a different way of working which will naturally lead to a better use of our money . ''

he says they 'll try the idea in six test areas : `` i 'll be able to compare that with the usual way of working to make sure that it 's safe , to make sure it is working effectively , and to make sure people like it .
`` it is an intention for us to make this the norm because i think it 's better for our service users and will help me attract more social workers into norfolk . ''

documents.title: council agrees to buy 'historic ' 17th century shop
text: north norfolk district council has agreed to buy a community shop near aylsham .
the store in itteringham has been run by volunteers for nearly a quarter of a century , although the shop dates from 1637 .
the owners are selling the building , and this morning the council 's cabinet agreed to buy it , to preserve it as a shop .
counillor judy oliver said : `` the council sees this as a great community asset which has been run by the community association for years very successfully . ''

documents.title: council proposal may save village shop
text: a village shop which has been trading since 1637 may be bought by north norfolk district council , to save it from closing .
the store at itteringham , near aylsham , is run as a community shop and cafe , but the current owners have decided to sell the premises .
councillors will discuss the proposal at a meeting today .

documents.title: possible explanation of sperm whales on beach
text: researchers believe nearly 30 sperm whales which became stranded on beaches across northern europe last year , may have been the victims of large solar storms .
two them were washed up at hunstanton .

the research by german scientists , published in the international journal of astrobiology , says the storms distorted the earth 's magnetic field and caused species which rely on it for navigation to become confused and head into shallow waters .

documents.title: tuesday 's weather : cloudy , with a few outbreaks of rain possible
text: it will be rather cloudy this morning , with a few outbreaks of rain possible along our coastal counties .
some brighter spells could develop during the afternoon leading to a warm and humid feel , but further outbreaks of rain are likely later on .
top temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
get a more detailed forecast , wherever you live , from bbc weather

BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning norfolk
text: welcome to tuesday 's live coverage .

rounding up the local news so far this morning , and there 's a plan to change the way social workers support disabled and elderly people in the north of the county , which experts say will help them say independent for longer .
a village shop at itteringham near aylsham may be bought by councillors , following a decision by the current owners to sell the premises .
and researchers believe they 've discovered the reason sperm whales became stranded on beaches last year , including two at hunstanton .
more on all of these stories shortly , but we 'll start the day with a look at the weather prospects with kate kinsella .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for our regular updates , but we 'll be back in the morning from 08:00 to do it all again .
scroll down to find out what 's been happening during the day , and remember , any breaking news overnight will still appear here .
we 'll leave you with this photograph taken by one of our bbc weather watchers - as if we needed reminding it 's been a pretty grey day .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : clear spells dominate but remaining humid
text: clear spells will dominate during a humid night with a few showers and outbreaks of mainly light rain across the bbc east region .
tuesday will begin with cloud with any rain or drizzle becoming heavier for a time .
sunny spells will develop , but these could also trigger a few showers .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 73f ) .
more details from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: terminally ill bike fan joins convoy
text: terminally ill bike fan joins convoy

documents.title: greater anglia warns of delay on sheringham to norwich service
text: 15:46 sheringham to norwich is being delayed at north walsham due to a trespass incident .
rs

documents.title: teenager wins two medals at first school games
text: a pupil from sprowston community high school in norwich has won two medals at the school games national finals at loughborough university .
ruby bishop , 13 , was competing in the wheelchair tennis girls singles and doubles competitions .
she won a bronze medal in the singles , and a silver in the doubles .
she said : `` i 've played really well .
i 've improved my serve since i 've last played in a tournament , so i 'm really happy with that .
`` i 'm leaving with two medals which is great for my first school games . ''
the event had about 1,600 athletes competing across 12 sports , seven of which included disability disciplines .

documents.title: norwich death 'not sus
text: the death of a man in his 50s , whose body was found in norwich earlier today , is not being treated as sus say police .
officers were called shortly after 08:30 following reports a body had been found in an area near king street and carrow road .
inquiries carried out at the scene have confirmed there were no sus circumstances surrounding the death .

documents.title: renewed appeal after second incident in norwich street
text: police are linking an incident , in which damage was caused to a vehicle parked on russell street in norwich yesterday evening , with one earlier in the day in which a bottle containing petrol was thrown at a property in the same street .
the bottle set light to mattresses at the house at about 01:15 on sunday , but no-one was harmed .
later , at about 22:45 , the vehicle had all its windows smashed .
insp darren brookes said : `` we are currently treating these crimes as linked and believe the suspect/s to be targeting a specific person .
`` due to our concerns this resident has been moved from their address and officers continue to provide an increased policing presence at that location .
`` i would like to appeal directly to those causing this damage and reiterate that the person you are targeting is no longer at this address .
`` continued criminal activity is only affecting others in the local community . ''

documents.title: shadow chancellor john mcdonnell says burston strike rally teaches lessons of `` determination and courage ''
text: shadow chancellor of the exchequer john mcdonnell appeared as a speaker and took part in the march at the burston strike rally on sunday .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: first bridge opens over northern distributor road
text: a village north of norwich is celebrating the end of roadworks linked to a new bridge over the northern distributor road ( ndr ) around norwich .
buxton road in spixworth is open again after two weeks of upheaval , although there are still bits and pieces to finish off .

although it 's the first bridge to open over the ndr , john birchall , from norfolk county council , says there 'll be no official opening : `` given that we had the opportunity to open it on monday morning we did n't want to delay that and hold up the opening by having a ribbon cutting or anything like that .
`` we thought it was more important to get it open so people can start using it and avoid some of the disruption they 've had to endure . ''

documents.title: police investigate sudden death
text: a man 's body has been discovered in norwich , in an area between king street and carrow road .
the death is being treated as unexplained , and inquiries are taking place to establish the circumstances surrounding the incident .
the area has been sealed off while officers carry out their investigation .

documents.title: breakingduchess of cambridge expecting third child
text: kensington palace has announced that kate , duchess of cambridge is expecting her third child .
the duke and duchess of cambridge have recently moved their primary residence to kensington palace in london after beginning married life at anmer hall on the sandringham estate .
prince william has also finished his work with the east anglia air ambulance , based in cambridge .
read more here on the pregnancy as further details emerge .

documents.title: petrol bomb thrown at property in norwich
text: a police investigation is under way after a petrol bomb was thrown at a property in norwich .
the incident in russell street , which happened at around 01:15 yesterday , set light to mattresses at the house .
insp lisa hooper says it was `` very fortunate '' that nobody was injured , but the occupants were left extremely distressed .
anyone with information is asked to contact norfolk police or crimestoppers .

documents.title: best ever burghley for piggy
text: norfolk 's piggy french had her best ever result at the burghley horse trials this weekend .
the eventer , who 's from north elmham , came second overall .
yorkshireman oliver townend won on his horse ballaghmor class , french finished 1.3 penalties behind townend on board vanir kamira , with reigning british open champion gemma tattersall third .
it 's just amazing , i ca n't believe it .
what a difference a year makes , hey ?
we 're just going to enjoy it . ''
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: hunt for knife-wielding clown is no joke
text: police were called out to reports of clowns running around north lynn on sunday night .
three units responded when a member of the public claimed to have seen three clowns - one with a knife - near reid way , shortly before midnight .
they searched the area but could find `` no trace of 'clowns ' '' , an officer told us .

documents.title: monday 's weather : misty , murky , mild and muggy
text: most places will have a dull and damp start , with cloudy skies and some light rain and drizzle .
this afternoon will be drier and possibly brighter as some sunny spells start to develop .
top temperature : 20c ( 68f ) .
get a full forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather
